tn.ref: we are your flesh and bone
tn.text: AT: "we are your relatives" or "we have the same ancestors as you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This was the temporary name for Jerusalem after Jebusites conquered the city, before the Israelites conquered it. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: that is, the city of David
tn.text: AT: "and they called it the city of David"

tn.ref: so he was made a commander
tn.text: AT: "so David made Joab a commander" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
AT: "The Israelites made the wall around the city stronger"
This refers to a fortress in Jerusalem, probably built by the Jebusites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: who showed themselves strong with him in his kingdom
tn.text: AT: "who helped David's kingdom to remain strong"
"and killed many of the Philistines." - (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: At that time David was in his stronghold, a cave, while the Philistines had established their camp at Bethlehem
tn.text: AT: "David was in a safe place in a cave while the Philistines' soldiers were guarding Bethlehem"

tn.ref: the Philistines had established their camp at Bethlehem
tn.text: "the Philistines had stationed soldiers in Bethlehem"

tn.ref: well of Bethlehem, the well at the gate
tn.text: These two phrases refer to the same well. The second specifies which well in Bethlehem. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: Far be it far from me, Yahweh, that I should drink this.
tn.text: AT: "God, please never allow me to drink such a sacrifice at the costs of my men!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: Should I drink the blood of men who have risked their lives?
tn.text: David is saying with this question that the water is precious because of the sacrifice made by those who obtained it. AT: "I would not drink the blood of men who are willing to die for me" or "I will not drink water that men have risked their lives to get" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
AT: "Abishai was a leader of the three mighty warriors" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: he was given double honor and became their captain
tn.text: AT: "the soldiers had great respected for Abishai and they made him their leader, even though they did not count him as one of the Three warriors"
These are acts that show courage, strength, or skill.

tn.ref: a spear like a weaver's beam
he was named alongside the three mighty men
tn.text: "he was as famous as the 3 mighty men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: He was more highly regarded than the thirty soldiers in general, but he was not regarded quite as highly as the three most elite soldiers
tn.text: AT: "The people respected him more than the 30 soldiers, but not as much as the 3 most highly skilled soldiers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is a person or a group of people responsible for protecting somebody important.
